However, it is only now starting to be understood and used in mainstream applications. Machine Learning can be divided into three categories: Supervised learning Unsupervised learning Reinforcement learning. Let‚Äôs get into the details: Supervised Learning: The computer takes in data about some system we're interested in, learns some basic rules about this system by looking at the data we've given it, builds a model from its analysis of the data, and then makes predictions that are more accurate than random guesses would be on new data points which were not used at all for training. 2. Unsupervised Learning: The computer takes in data about some system we're interested in, learns some basic rules about this system by looking at the data we've given it, and then makes predictions that are more accurate than random guesses would be on new data points which were not used at all for training. 3. Reinforcement Learning: The computer is given a reward function that measures how well it's doing at any given time. The computer can then take a certain amount of time (measured in steps) to try to maximize its reward. All three types of machine learning are most helpful when trained on big data sets, as opposed to small data sets.
